clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Efficacy and Tolerability of SYSTANE Complete in Patients With Dry Eye Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Clinical Efficacy and Tolerability of SYSTANE Complete in Adult Patients With Dry Eye Disease Following Topical Ocular Use for 4 Weeks: A Multicenter Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the clinical effectiveness and tolerability of SYSTANE® Complete in adult patients with dry eye disease. Fluorescein-stained tear film break-up time (TFBUT) will be evaluated as the primary objective.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients will attend 4 scheduled visits: Screening Visit (Day -7 to Day 0), Visit 1/Baseline Visit (Day 1), Visit 2 (Day 14) and Visit 3 (Day 28).
This study is sponsored by Alcon, A Novartis Company.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Tear Film Break-up Time (TFBUT) at Day 14
primary_outcome.description: TFBUT will be assessed using fluorescein, an ocular staining dye

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in dry eye symptom score at Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: As reported by the patient using a Likert scale post drop instillation
As reported by the patient using a Likert scale post drop instillation
As reported by the patient using an assessment questionnaire post drop instillation

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in ocular discomfort at Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: As reported by the patient using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in corneal staining score at Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of ocular staining using staining dye under a slit lamp

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in response to the revised IDEEL questionnaire at Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: As reported by the patient using a subjective questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in EQ-5D-5L score(s) at Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: As reported by the patient using a validated questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in TFBUT at Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: TFBUT will be assessed using fluorescein, an ocular staining dye

arm_group.description: Propylene glycol-based eye drops, 1 drop in each eye twice a day (BID) (morning and evening) for 28 days. Patients can administer additional doses in between the scheduled daily doses as needed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have TFBUT of ≤ 5 seconds in at least one eye at Screening visit.
- Must have best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) of ≥ 20/80 (or ≥ 55 letters score or ≥ 0.6 early treatment diabetic retinopathy study (ETDRS) log of the minimum angle of resolution (LogMAR) value) in both eyes at the Screening visit.
- Must be willing to discontinue use of all artificial tear supplements and use only the study product as directed for the entire study duration.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of hypersensitivity to the study drug or any of its excipients or to drugs of similar chemical classes.
- Use of any topical ocular medication preserved with benzalkonium chloride or other products known to be toxic to the tear film lipid layer within 1 month prior to the Screening visit.
Other protocol-specified inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply.
